Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: pac

Arguments.Name: admin
Arguments.Description: Work with your Power Platform Admin Account

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List all environments from your tenant

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: List all environments that contain given string in their name or ID

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: List all environments with the given type

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: List all environments that contain given string in their name

Arguments.Name: --organization-id
Arguments.Description: List all environments that contain given string in their organization ID

Arguments.Name: --application
Arguments.Description: List all environments that have specified application installed. To specify application, use unique name or ID

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Creates a Dataverse instance in your tenant

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Sets the name of the environment

Arguments.Name: --region
Arguments.Description: Sets the environment's region name. [defaults to unitedstates]

Arguments.Name: --currency
Arguments.Description: Sets the currency used for your environment. [defaults to USD]

Arguments.Name: --language
Arguments.Description: Sets the language used for your environment. [defaults to English]

Arguments.Name: --templates
Arguments.Description: Sets the Dynamics 365 app that needs to be deployed, passed as comma separated values. For example: -tm 'D365_Sample, D365_Sales'

Arguments.Name: --domain
Arguments.Description: The domain name is part of the environment URL. If domain name is already in use, a numeric value is appended to the domain name. For example: If 'contoso' is already in use, then the environment URL is updated to https://{contoso}0.crm.dynamics.com

Arguments.Name: --input-file
Arguments.Description: The verb arguments to be passed in a .json input file. For example: {'name' : 'contoso'}. The arguments passed through command-line will take precedence over arguments from the .json input file

Arguments.Name: --async
Arguments.Description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: --user
Arguments.Description: Object ID or user principal name (UPN) of Microsoft Entra ID user to be assigned to the environment

Arguments.Name: backup
Arguments.Description: Takes a manual backup of your environment

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that requires backup

Arguments.Name: --label
Arguments.Description: Sets the backup label as provided

Arguments.Name: set-backup-retention-period
Arguments.Description: Takes a manual backup of your environment

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that requires backup

Arguments.Name: --backup-retention-period
Arguments.Description: Sets the backup retention period in days as provided. Valid values are: 7, 14, 21, 28

Arguments.Name: --async
Arguments.Description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Deletes the environment from your tenant

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that needs to be deleted from your tenant

Arguments.Name: --async
Arguments.Description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: reset
Arguments.Description: Reset the environment from your tenant

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: URL or ID of the Environment that needs to be reset

Arguments.Name: --currency
Arguments.Description: Sets the currency used for your environment. [defaults to USD]

Arguments.Name: --domain
Arguments.Description: The domain name is part of the environment URL. If domain name is already in use, a numeric value is appended to the domain name. For example: If 'contoso' is already in use, then the environment URL is updated to https://{contoso}0.crm.dynamics.com

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Sets the name of the environment

Arguments.Name: --language
Arguments.Description: Sets the language used for your environment. [defaults to English]

Arguments.Name: --purpose
Arguments.Description: Sets the description used to associate the environment with a specific intent

Arguments.Name: --templates
Arguments.Description: Sets the Dynamics 365 app that needs to be deployed, passed as comma separated values. For example: -tm 'D365_Sample, D365_Sales'

Arguments.Name: --input-file
Arguments.Description: The verb arguments to be passed in a .json input file. For example: {'name' : 'contoso'}. The arguments passed through command-line will take precedence over arguments from the .json input file

Arguments.Name: --async
Arguments.Description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: list-backups
Arguments.Description: Lists all backups of your environment

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: List all environments that contain a given string in their Environment ID or URL

Arguments.Name: restore
Arguments.Description: Restores an environment to a given backup

Arguments.Name: --source-env
Arguments.Description: Environment URL or ID of the source environment required for restore

Arguments.Name: --target-env
Arguments.Description: Environment URL or ID of the target environment required for restore. This would default to source URL/ID if not provided

Arguments.Name: --selected-backup
Arguments.Description: DateTime of the backup in 'mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm' format OR string 'latest'

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Optional name of the restored environment

Arguments.Name: --skip-audit-data
Arguments.Description: Switch indicating whether audit data should be skipped

Arguments.Name: --async
Arguments.Description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: copy
Arguments.Description: Copy Source Environment to Destination Environment

Arguments.Name: --source-env
Arguments.Description: Environment URL or ID of the source environment that is being copied

Arguments.Name: --target-env
Arguments.Description: Environment URL or ID of the target environment

Arguments.Name: --skip-audit-data
Arguments.Description: Switch indicating whether audit data should be skipped

Arguments.Name: --async
Arguments.Description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: This command lists the status of all the operations in progress

Arguments.Name: assign-user
Arguments.Description: Assign a user to a target Dataverse environment with specified security role

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: ID or URL of the environment to assign a user to

Arguments.Name: --user
Arguments.Description: Object ID or user principal name (UPN) of Microsoft Entra ID user to be assigned to the environment or Application ID if assigning an Application User

Arguments.Name: --role
Arguments.Description: Name or ID of security role to be applied to user

Arguments.Name: --application-user
Arguments.Description: Specifies whether the input user is an application user. If a business unit isn't specified, the application user is added to the authenticated users business unit

Arguments.Name: --business-unit
Arguments.Description: ID of business unit to associate application user with

Arguments.Name: --async
Arguments.Description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false

Arguments.Name: assign-group
Arguments.Description: Assign group to target Dataverse environment with specified security role

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: ID or URL of the environment to assign a user to

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: Microsoft Entra ID object ID of group to assign to target Dataverse environment

Arguments.Name: --group-name
Arguments.Description: Name of the group or team to create in Dataverse

Arguments.Name: --role
Arguments.Description: Name or ID of security role to be applied to user

Arguments.Name: --business-unit
Arguments.Description: ID of business unit to associate application user with

Arguments.Name: list-app-templates
Arguments.Description: Lists all supported Dataverse templates of model-driven apps in Dynamics 365

Arguments.Name: --region
Arguments.Description: Sets the environment's region name. [defaults to unitedstates]

Arguments.Name: create-service-principal
Arguments.Description: Add Microsoft Entra ID application and associated application user to the Dataverse environment

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: Environment (ID, org ID, url, unique name, or partial name)

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Application name to create in Entra ID

Arguments.Name: --role
Arguments.Description: Name or ID of security role to be applied to application user. The default value is: 'System Administrator'

Arguments.Name: list-service-principal
Arguments.Description: List Microsoft Entra ID applications which have access to Dataverse

Arguments.Name: --max
Arguments.Description: Max number of applications to show. Default: 20

Arguments.Name: set-governance-config
Arguments.Description: Enable, disable, and edit managed environments

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: URL or ID of the environment for which managed environments need to be enabled, disabled or edited

Arguments.Name: --protection-level
Arguments.Description: Set protection level : 'Standard' to enable managed environments, 'Basic' to disable managed environments

Arguments.Name: --exclude-analysis
Arguments.Description: Exclude usage insights for the environment from the weekly digest email

Arguments.Name: --include-insights
Arguments.Description: Include insights in the Power Platform Admin Center homepage cards

Arguments.Name: --max-limit-user-sharing
Arguments.Description: If group sharing is disabled, specify the number of people that makers can share canvas apps with

Arguments.Name: --settings-file
Arguments.Description: The .json file to output tenant settings

Arguments.Name: application
Arguments.Description: Work with Microsoft Entra ID applications

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List Microsoft Entra ID applications registered under your tenant

Arguments.Name: register
Arguments.Description: Register Microsoft Entra ID application with your tenant

Arguments.Name: unregister
Arguments.Description: Unregister Microsoft Entra ID application from your tenant

Arguments.Name: application
Arguments.Description: Commands for listing and installing available Dataverse applications from AppSource

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List available Dataverse applications from AppSource

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: List available Dataverse applications for given environment (by ID or url); if not specified, list all applications in the tenant

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Location of the JSON file to be created with list of the Dataverse applications from AppSource

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Installs Dataverse application to given environment

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: List available Dataverse applications for given environment (by ID or url); if not specified, list all applications in the tenant

Arguments.Name: --application-name
Arguments.Description: Unique name of the application to install to the target environment

Arguments.Name: --application-list
Arguments.Description: Location of the JSON file with list of the Dataverse applications from AppSource to be installed

Arguments.Name: auth

Arguments.Name: create

Arguments.Name: --environment

Arguments.Name: data
Arguments.Description: Import and export data from Dataverse

Arguments.Name: --schemaFile
Arguments.Description: Schema file name. It can be created using the Configuration Migration Tool

Arguments.Name: --dataFile
Arguments.Description: File name for data zip file. Default data.zip

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: Allow overwrite of the output data file if it already exists

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Output more diagnostic information during data import/export

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: Environment (ID, org ID, url, unique name, or partial name)

Arguments.Name: --dataDirectory
Arguments.Description: Directory name with data for import

Arguments.Name: --data
Arguments.Description: Zip file or directory name with data for import

Arguments.Name: --connection-count
Arguments.Description: Number of parallel connections to use during import. Default: 5

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Output more diagnostic information during data import/export

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: Environment (ID, org ID, url, unique name, or partial name)

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Show help for the Microsoft Power Platform CLI

Arguments.Name: modelbuilder
Arguments.Description: Code Generator for Dataverse APIs and Tables

Arguments.Name: build
Arguments.Description: Builds a code model for Dataverse APIs and Tables

Arguments.Name: --suppressGeneratedCodeAttribute
Arguments.Description: When set, this suppress all generated objects being tagged with the code generation engine and version

Arguments.Name: --language
Arguments.Description: The language to use for the generated proxy code. This value can be either 'CS' or 'VB'. The default language is 'CS'

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: The namespace for the generated code. The default namespace is the global namespace

Arguments.Name: --serviceContextName
Arguments.Description: The name for the generated service context. If a value is passed in, it's used for the Service Context. If not, no Service Context is generated

Arguments.Name: --generatesdkmessages
Arguments.Description: When set, emits Sdk message classes as part of code generation

Arguments.Name: --emitentityetc
Arguments.Description: When set, includes the entity ETC ( entity type code ) in the generated code

Arguments.Name: --emitvirtualattributes
Arguments.Description: When set, includes the Virtual Attributes of entities in the generated code

Arguments.Name: --emitfieldsclasses
Arguments.Description: Generate a constants structure that contains all of the field names by entity at the time of code generation

Arguments.Name: --entitynamesfilter
Arguments.Description: Filters the list of entities are retrieved when reading data from Dataverse. Passed in as a semicolon separated list. Using the form <entitylogicalname>;<entitylogicalname>

Arguments.Name: --messagenamesfilter
Arguments.Description: Filters the list of messages that are retrieved when reading data from Dataverse. Passed in as a semicolon separated list, required messages (Create, Update, Delete, Retrieve, RetrieveMultiple, Associate and Disassociate) are always included. Use a trailing or leading asterisk (*) with the names of the messages to allow for all messages starting with or ending with a string. Using the form <messagename>;<messagename>

Arguments.Name: --outdirectory
Arguments.Description: Write directory for entity, message, and optionset files

Arguments.Name: --entitytypesfolder
Arguments.Description: Folder name that contains entities. The default name is 'Entities'

Arguments.Name: --messagestypesfolder
Arguments.Description: Folder name that contains messages. The default name is 'Messages'

Arguments.Name: --optionsetstypesfolder
Arguments.Description: Folder name that contains option sets. The default name is 'OptionSets'

Arguments.Name: --generateGlobalOptionSets
Arguments.Description: Emit all Global OptionSets. Note: If an entity contains a reference to a global optionset, it is emitted even if this switch is not present

Arguments.Name: --writesettingsTemplateFile
Arguments.Description: When set, writes a settings file out to the output directory with the current passed settings or default settings

Arguments.Name: --settingsTemplateFile
Arguments.Description: Contains Settings to be used for this run of the Dataverse Model Builder, overrides any duplicate parameters on command line. Can't be set when --writesettingstemplate is used

Arguments.Name: --suppressINotifyPattern
Arguments.Description: When enabled, doesn't write the INotify wrappers for properties and classes

Arguments.Name: --logLevel
Arguments.Description: Log level. The default value is 'Off'

Arguments.Description: Displays information about the current Dataverse organization

Arguments.Description: Lists all of the Dataverse organizations the user has access to

Arguments.Description: Show only environments containing filter criteria

Arguments.Description: File with FetchXML query to run

Arguments.Name: --filter
Arguments.Description: Show only settings containing filter criteria

Arguments.Description: Name of the setting to update

Arguments.Name: --value
Arguments.Description: Value to which setting should be updated to

Arguments.Description: Select default organization for current authentication profile

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: Default environment (ID, url, unique name, or partial name)

Arguments.Name: package
Arguments.Description: Commands for working with Dataverse package projects

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse package project

Arguments.Name: --package-name
Arguments.Description: Sets the default name of the package. Applies to the generation of ImportExtension.GetNameOfImport

Arguments.Name: add-external-package
Arguments.Description: Adds a package that is external to the Dataverse solution system to a Package Deployer Package project

Arguments.Name: --package-type
Arguments.Description: The type of the package being added. For example: 'xpp' for FnO packages

Arguments.Name: --import-order
Arguments.Description: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements

Arguments.Name: --skip-validation
Arguments.Description: Adds the item to the project file even if the file doesn't exist or appears to be invalid. Note: Using this doesn't affect any validation performed by MSBuild

Arguments.Name: add-solution
Arguments.Description: Adds a prebuilt Dataverse solution file to a Package Deployer Package project

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Path to the Dataverse solution file. The file must be a compressed ZIP file

Arguments.Name: --import-order
Arguments.Description: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements

Arguments.Name: --skip-validation
Arguments.Description: Adds the item to the project file even if the file doesn't exist or appears to be invalid. Note: Using this doesn't affect any validation performed by MSBuild

Arguments.Name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
Arguments.Description: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported

Arguments.Name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
Arguments.Description: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported

Arguments.Name: --import-mode
Arguments.Description: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution

Arguments.Name: --missing-dependency-behavior
Arguments.Description: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment

Arguments.Name: --dependency-overrides
Arguments.Description: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: '<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>'. Where minVersion and maxVersion are optional but should be in .NET version format syntax

Arguments.Name: add-reference
Arguments.Description: Adds reference to Dataverse solution project

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: The path to the referenced Dataverse solution project

Arguments.Name: --import-order
Arguments.Description: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements

Arguments.Name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
Arguments.Description: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported

Arguments.Name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
Arguments.Description: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported

Arguments.Name: --import-mode
Arguments.Description: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution

Arguments.Name: --missing-dependency-behavior
Arguments.Description: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment

Arguments.Name: --dependency-overrides
Arguments.Description: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: '<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>'. Where minVersion and maxVersion are optional but should be in .NET version format syntax

Arguments.Description: Path to a package dll or zip file with a package

Arguments.Name: --settings
Arguments.Description: Runtime Package Settings that are passed to the package that is being deployed. The format of the string must be 'key=value|key=value'

Arguments.Description: Emit verbose logs to the log outputs

Arguments.Description: Path to a package dll or zip file with a package

Arguments.Description: Emit verbose logs to the log outputs

Arguments.Name: pcf
Arguments.Description: Commands for working with Power Apps component framework projects

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initializes a directory with a new Power Apps component framework project

Arguments.Name: --template
Arguments.Description: Choose a template for the component

Arguments.Name: --framework
Arguments.Description: The rendering framework for control. The default value is 'none', which means HTML

Arguments.Name: --run-npm-install
Arguments.Description: Auto run 'npm install' after the control is created. The default value is 'false'

Arguments.Name: push
Arguments.Description: Import the Power Apps component framework project into the current Dataverse organization

Arguments.Name: --publisher-prefix
Arguments.Description: Customization prefix value for the Dataverse solution publisher

Arguments.Name: --verbosity
Arguments.Description: Verbosity level for MSBuild when building the temporary solution wrapper

Arguments.Name: --force-import
Arguments.Description: Force a full update of the control as part of a temporary solution

Arguments.Name: --interactive
Arguments.Description: Indicates that actions in the build are allowed to interact with the user. Don't use this argument in an automated scenario where interactivity is not expected

Arguments.Name: --incremental
Arguments.Description: Pushes only files which are diifferent using entity updates

Arguments.Name: --strategy
Arguments.Description: Updates patch version for 'ControlManifest.xml' files using specified strategy. If using gittags, set a personal access token in the following environment variable 'PacCli.PAT'

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Absolute/Relative path of the 'ControlManifest.xml' for updating

Arguments.Name: --allmanifests
Arguments.Description: Updates patch version for all 'ControlManifest.xml' files

Arguments.Name: --updatetarget
Arguments.Description: Specify which target manifest needs to be updated

Arguments.Name: --filename
Arguments.Description: Tracker CSV file name to be used when using filetracking as a strategy. The default value is 'ControlsStateVersionInfo.csv'

Arguments.Name: --pipeline
Arguments.Description: Pipeline name or ID for which show list of details such as deployment stages

Arguments.Name: plugin
Arguments.Description: Commands for working with Dataverse plug-in class library

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse plug-in class library

Arguments.Name: --signing-key-file-path
Arguments.Description: Relative path to the Dataverse plug-in assembly originator key file for signing

Arguments.Name: --author
Arguments.Description: One or more authors of the Dataverse Plug-in Package

Arguments.Name: --skip-signing
Arguments.Description: Skip plug-in assembly signing that gives the plug-in assembly a strong name. The default value is 'false'

Arguments.Name: --pluginId
Arguments.Description: ID of plug-in assembly or plug-in package

Arguments.Name: --pluginFile
Arguments.Description: File name of plug-in assembly or plug-in package

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Type of item if not specified explicitly through --pluginFile. The default value is: 'Nuget'

Arguments.Name: --configuration
Arguments.Description: Build configuration. The default value is: 'Debug'

Arguments.Description: (Preview) Commands for working with Power Fx

Arguments.Name: repl
Arguments.Description: (Preview) Launch interactive Power Fx Read-Eval-Print Loop

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: (Preview) Run a file of Power Fx instructions

Arguments.Name: --echo
Arguments.Description: True if input commands should echo back to output

Arguments.Name: powerpages
Arguments.Description: Commands for working with Power Pages website

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List all Power Pages websites from the current Dataverse environment

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Enables verbose mode to provide more details

Arguments.Name: download
Arguments.Description: Download Power Pages website content from the current Dataverse environment

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Path where the Power Pages website content is downloaded

Arguments.Name: --webSiteId
Arguments.Description: Power Pages website ID to download

Arguments.Name: --includeEntities
Arguments.Description: Download only the entities specified for this argument using comma separated entity logical names

Arguments.Name: --excludeEntities
Arguments.Description: Comma separated list of entity logical names to exclude downloading

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: Power Pages website content to overwrite

Arguments.Name: --modelVersion
Arguments.Description: Power Pages website data model version to download

Arguments.Name: upload
Arguments.Description: Upload Power Pages website content to current Dataverse environment

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Path from where the Power Pages website content is uploaded

Arguments.Name: --deploymentProfile
Arguments.Description: Deployment profile name to be used. Defaults to 'default'

Arguments.Name: --forceUploadAll
Arguments.Description: Upload all Power Pages website content to the current Dataverse environment

Arguments.Name: --modelVersion
Arguments.Description: Power Pages website data model version to upload

Arguments.Name: bootstrap-migrate
Arguments.Description: Migrates HTML code from bootstrap V3 to V5

Arguments.Name: solution
Arguments.Description: Commands for working with Dataverse solution projects

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse solution project

Arguments.Name: --publisher-name
Arguments.Description: Name of the Dataverse solution publisher

Arguments.Name: --publisher-prefix
Arguments.Description: Customization prefix value for the Dataverse solution publisher

Arguments.Name: add-reference
Arguments.Description: Adds a reference from the project in the current directory to the project at 'path'

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: The path to the referenced project

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List all Solutions from the current Dataverse organization

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Delete a solution from Dataverse in the current environment

Arguments.Name: online-version
Arguments.Description: Sets version for solution loaded in Dataverse

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Update build or revision version for the solution

Arguments.Name: --strategy
Arguments.Description: Updates build version for 'Solution.xml' file using specified strategy. If using gittags, set personal access token in the following environment variable 'PacCli.PAT'

Arguments.Name: --filename
Arguments.Description: Tracker CSV file name to be used when using filetracking as a strategy. The default value is 'ControlsStateVersionInfo.csv'

Arguments.Name: --solutionPath
Arguments.Description: Path to Dataverse solution directory or Solution.xml file

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Path to solution zip file. If not specified, assumes the current folder is a cdsproj project

Arguments.Name: --activate-plugins
Arguments.Description: Activate plug-ins and workflows on the solution

Arguments.Name: --force-overwrite
Arguments.Description: Force an overwrite of unmanaged customizations

Arguments.Name: --skip-dependency-check
Arguments.Description: Skip dependency check against dependencies flagged as product update

Arguments.Name: --import-as-holding
Arguments.Description: Import the solution as a holding solution

Arguments.Name: --publish-changes
Arguments.Description: Publish your changes upon a successful import

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: --settings-file
Arguments.Description: The .json file with the deployment settings for connection references and environment variables

Arguments.Name: --skip-lower-version
Arguments.Description: Skip solution import if same or higher version is present in current environment

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: The name of the solution to be exported

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Path where the exported solution zip file is written

Arguments.Name: --managed
Arguments.Description: Whether the solution should be exported as a managed solution

Arguments.Name: --targetversion
Arguments.Description: The version that the exported solution will support

Arguments.Name: --include
Arguments.Description: Which settings should be included in the solution being exported

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: The exported solution file can overwrite the solution zip file on the local file system

Arguments.Name: clone
Arguments.Description: Create a solution project based on an existing solution in your organization

Arguments.Name: --targetversion
Arguments.Description: The version that the exported solution will support

Arguments.Name: --include
Arguments.Description: Which settings should be included in the solution being exported

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: --processCanvasApps
Arguments.Description: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. The default value is 'false'

Arguments.Name: --packagetype
Arguments.Description: Specifies the extraction type for the solution. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'. The default value is: 'Both'

Arguments.Name: --localize
Arguments.Description: Extract or merge all string resources into .resx files

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: --max-async-wait-time
Arguments.Description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes

Arguments.Name: add-license
Arguments.Description: Add license and plan info to the solution

Arguments.Name: --planDefinitionFile
Arguments.Description: License plan definition file in CSV format; expected columns: Service ID, Display name, More info URL

Arguments.Name: --planMappingFile
Arguments.Description: License plan mapping file in CSV format; expected columns: Service ID, Component name

Arguments.Name: check
Arguments.Description: Upload a Dataverse solution project to run against the Power Apps Checker service

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Path where one or more solution files to be checked exist. The path can contain glob/wildcard characters

Arguments.Name: --solutionUrl
Arguments.Description: SAS Uri pointing to solution.zip to be analyzed

Arguments.Name: --geo
Arguments.Description: Which geographical instance of the Power Apps Checker service to use

Arguments.Name: --customEndpoint
Arguments.Description: Specify a custom URL as the Power Apps Checker endpoint

Arguments.Name: --ruleLevelOverride
Arguments.Description: Path to a file containing a JSON array rules and levels to override. Accepted values for OverrideLevel are: Critical, High, Medium, Low, Informational. Example: [{'Id':'meta-remove-dup-reg','OverrideLevel':'Medium'},{'Id':'il-avoid-specialized-update-ops','OverrideLevel':'Medium'}]

Arguments.Name: --ruleSet
Arguments.Description: Select a rule set that is executed as part of this build. Values: A valid Guid, 'AppSource Certification', 'Solution Checker' (default)

Arguments.Name: --excludedFiles
Arguments.Description: Exclude Files from the Analysis. Pass as comma-separated values

Arguments.Name: --saveResults
Arguments.Description: Uses current environment to store solution analysis results that can be seen in Solution Health Hub App. By default, this argument is set to false

Arguments.Name: create-settings
Arguments.Description: Create a settings file from solution zip or solution folder

Arguments.Name: --solution-folder
Arguments.Description: Path to the local, unpacked solution folder: either the root of the 'Other/Solution.xml' file or a folder with a .cdsproj file

Arguments.Name: --settings-file
Arguments.Description: The .json file with the deployment settings for connection references and environment variables

Arguments.Name: pack
Arguments.Description: Package solution components on local filesystem into solution.zip (SolutionPackager)

Arguments.Name: --zipfile
Arguments.Description: The full path to the solution ZIP file

Arguments.Name: --folder
Arguments.Description: The path to the root folder on the local filesystem. When unpacking or extracting, this is written to. When packing this is read from

Arguments.Name: --packagetype
Arguments.Description: When unpacking or extracting, use to specify dual Managed and Unmanaged operation. When packing, use to specify Managed or Unmanaged from a previous unpack 'Both'. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'. The default value is 'Unmanaged'

Arguments.Name: --log
Arguments.Description: The path to the log file

Arguments.Name: --errorlevel
Arguments.Description: Minimum logging level for log output [Verbose|Info|Warning|Error|Off]. The default value is 'Info'

Arguments.Name: --singleComponent
Arguments.Description: Only perform action on a single component type [WebResource|Plugin|Workflow|None]. The default value is 'None'

Arguments.Name: --allowDelete
Arguments.Description: Dictates if delete operations may occur. The default value is 'false'

Arguments.Name: --allowWrite
Arguments.Description: Dictates if write operations may occur. The default value is 'false'

Arguments.Name: --clobber
Arguments.Description: Enables that files marked read-only can be deleted or overwritten. The default value is 'false'

Arguments.Name: --map
Arguments.Description: The full path to a mapping xml file from which to read component folders to pack

Arguments.Name: --sourceLoc
Arguments.Description: Generates a template resource file. Valid only on extract. Possible values are 'auto', or language code of the language you wish to export. You can use Language Code Identifier (LCID), or International Organization for Standardization (ISO) language code formats. When present, this extracts the string resources from the given locale as a neutral .resx. If 'auto' or just the long or short form of the switch is specified, the base locale for the solution is used

Arguments.Name: --localize
Arguments.Description: Extract or merge all string resources into .resx files

Arguments.Name: --useLcid
Arguments.Description: Use Language Code Identifier (LCID) values (1033) rather than International Organization for Standardization (ISO) codes (en-US) for language files

Arguments.Name: --useUnmanagedFileForMissingManaged
Arguments.Description: Use the same XML source file when packaging for Managed and only Unmanaged XML file is found; applies to AppModuleSiteMap, AppModuleMap, FormXml files

Arguments.Name: --disablePluginRemap
Arguments.Description: Disabled plug-in fully qualified type name remapping. The default value is 'false'

Arguments.Name: --processCanvasApps
Arguments.Description: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. The default value is 'false'

Arguments.Description: List of Virtual Agents in the current or target Dataverse environment

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Poll the deployment status of a specified Virtual Agent in the current or target Dataverse environment

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile

Arguments.Name: --bot-id
Arguments.Description: The ID of a Virtual Agent (Chatbot)

Arguments.Name: extract-translation
Arguments.Description: Extracts file containing localized content for one or more bots

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile

Arguments.Name: --sourcedir
Arguments.Description: Source solution directory. When specified, will ignore the connected environment when looking for bots and instead look for content in the solution folder

Arguments.Name: --bot
Arguments.Description: The Chatbot ID or schema name (unique name found in Bot Details or file name in solution explorer)

Arguments.Name: --outdir
Arguments.Description: The output directory to write to

Arguments.Name: --format
Arguments.Description: The file format in which to write localized files, either 'resx' or 'json'. The default is 'resx'

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Write localization files for all supported languages. By default, only the primary language is written

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: Allow overwrite of the output data file if it already exists

Arguments.Name: merge-translation
Arguments.Description: Merge files containing localized content for one or more bots

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile

Arguments.Name: --sourcedir
Arguments.Description: Source solution directory. When specified, will ignore the connected environment when looking for bots and instead look for content in the solution folder

Arguments.Name: --file
Arguments.Description: The list of files that contain translations. Glob patterns are supported

Arguments.Name: --whatif
Arguments.Description: Does not execute the command, but outputs the details of what would happen

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Output more diagnostic information during data import/export

Arguments.Name: extract-template
Arguments.Description: Extracts a template file from an existing bot in an environment

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile

Arguments.Name: --bot
Arguments.Description: The Chatbot ID or schema name (unique name found in Bot Details or file name in solution explorer)

Arguments.Name: --templateFileName
Arguments.Description: Location of the yaml file to write the bot template to

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: Allow overwrite of the output data file if it already exists

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Creates a new bot using an existing template file as the reference

Arguments.Name: --environment
Arguments.Description: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile

Arguments.Name: --schemaName
Arguments.Description: The schema name (unique name) of the new bot

Arguments.Name: --templateFileName
Arguments.Description: Source yaml file containing the bot template that was extracted using the extract-template command

Arguments.Name: --displayName
Arguments.Description: The display name of the new bot
